name: Clone a Group
title: Clone a Group
label_names: how do i clone a group
body:
You have the option to clone any group in your console, but this feature works differently depending on the type of group you would like to clone.

Click on a group type below to learn how to clone it.

Note:If you'd like to clone an archived group, start by restoring the group. See the Archiving Groups section of the Users and Groups article for more information.

How to Clone a Console Group

Cloning a standard group created in the console will create a new group containing the same users. Follow the steps below to clone a console group:

  1. In your KSAT console, go to the Users tab.
  2. Select the Groups subtab. 
  3. From the listed groups, find the group you would like to clone.
  4. Under the Actions column, click the drop-down arrow of the desired group and select Clone.
  5. In the window that displays, enter a New Group Name and click Clone Group.

How to Clone a Provisioning-Managed Group

Cloning a group that is managed by Active Directory Integration (ADI) or System for Cross-Domain Identity Management (SCIM) will create a new group containing the same users. However, this new group will not be managed by provisioning. Visit our Active Directory Integration (ADI) Configuration Guide or our SCIM Configuration Guide for more information.

Follow the steps below to clone a provisioning-managed group:

  1. In your KSAT console, go to the Users tab.
  2. Select the Groups subtab. 
  3. From the listed groups, find the group you would like to clone.
  4. Under the Actions column, click the drop-down arrow of the desired group and select Clone.
  5. In the window that displays, enter a New Group Name and click Clone Group.

How to Clone a Smart Group

When cloning a Smart Group, you have the option to either create a new Smart Group or create a standard console group.

If you choose to create a new Smart Group while cloning, the new Smart Group will have the same criteria. You can change or customize these criteria once the new Smart Group has been created. Visit our Smart Groups Overview for more information.

If you choose to clone a Smart Group to create a standard console group, the new console group will contain the same users but will not have Smart Group capabilities. Follow the steps below to clone a Smart Group:

  1. In your KSAT console, go to the Users tab.
  2. Select the Groups subtab. 
  3. From the listed groups, find the group you would like to clone.
  4. Under the Actions column, click the drop-down arrow of the desired group and select Clone.
  5. In the window that displays, select Smart Group or Console Group.
  6. Then, enter a New Group Name and click Clone Group.

images.alt:
This image displays a three-option vertical dropdown or contextual menu, typically accessed from a preceding UI element (a partially visible black downward caret is present above the menu).

**UI Elements and Text:**

*   The menu contains three standard operational choices, each preceded by a black glyph icon:
    1.  **Clone:** Represented by an icon depicting two overlapping squares (duplication).
    2.  **Edit:** Represented by a pencil icon.
    3.  **Archive:** Represented by a file box or drawer icon.
*   The top menu item, **"Clone,"** is highlighted by a thick orange rectangular border, indicating the selection point being referenced.

**Context:** The menu provides standard lifecycle management actions (duplication, modification, and archiving) for an associated entity or record.
images.context: lick the drop-down arrow of the desired group and select Clone.

images.alt:
A modal dialog box is displayed with the title **"Clone "Clickers" Group"** in bold, black text.

1.  **Header:** The top right features a standard 'X' icon for closing the dialog.
2.  **Input Field:** A label, **"New Group Name,"** is positioned above a text input field.
    *   The input field currently displays the placeholder text: *"Choose a group name"* (in gray italicized text) and has a light blue focus outline, indicating readiness for user input.
3.  **Action Buttons:** Located in the bottom right corner:
    *   **Cancel:** A secondary button (gray background, white text).
    *   **Clone Group:** A primary, affirmative action button (blue background, white text).
images.context: nter a New Group Name and click Clone Group.

images.alt:
This image displays a modal dialog box for cloning a user group, titled **"Clone 'Accounting' Group"**.

**Context and Warning Section:**
An orange-bordered warning box is present, labeled **"Active Directory Group Clone"**. The body text within this box reads: "You are cloning a group managed by Active Directory. The new group will **not** be managed by Active Directory." The word "**not**" is emphasized in bold font.

**Input Field:**
A field is provided for naming the new group, labeled **"New Group Name"**. The input box contains the placeholder text: "Choose a group name".

**Action Buttons:**
The bottom of the dialog contains two action buttons:
1. **"Cancel"** (Gray button)
2. **"Clone Group"** (Primary blue button)

A standard 'X' icon for closing the dialog is located in the top right corner.
images.context: ys, enter a New Group Name and click Clone Group.

images.alt:
The image displays a modal dialogue box titled **"Clone 'SG Multiple Failures Past Year' Group"**. A dismiss icon ('X') is located in the top right corner.

The dialogue is divided into functional sections:

1.  **Group Type Selection:**
    *   Subtitle: **Smart Group Clone**
    *   Instructional text: **"You are cloning a Smart Group. The new group should be a:"**
    *   Two radio button options are presented, both followed by a contextual help icon (?):
        *   **Smart Group** (Currently selected)
        *   **Console Group** (Unselected)

2.  **Naming Input:**
    *   Field Label: **New Group Name**
    *   Input Field: A single-line text input box containing the placeholder text: **"Choose a group name"**.

3.  **Action Footer:**
    *   Two action buttons are positioned at the bottom right:
        *   **Cancel** (Secondary button, dark grey)
        *   **Clone Group** (Primary action button, highlighted blue)
images.context: a New Group Name and click Clone Group.
